reviewText: Submarine expert / super-bad adventurer / international tough guy Wick Hayes (Jack Scalia) is sent on a mission to find out what happened to a missing submarine called SIREN 1. Now, w/ a team consisting of navy-types, led by R. Lee Ermy, Wick takes SIREN 2 into the ocean depths in search of clues. All the while, his tall, perfect hair remains fab-u-lous!  Oh no! The sub enters a strange area full of giant seaweed. What the...? Dead people! Wreckage! It's in the seaweed! Eeeeaagh! Sven is dead! Dear lord, Svvveeennnn! Can the crew of this plastic submarine possibly survive? THE RIFT is pure gold for the underwater cheeeze addict! The cadaverous acting, ding-a-ling dialog, and preposterous plot merge to form a perfect storm of supreme, mind-mulching goop! Toss in some big, rubbery monsters and this is nirvana!... P.S.- Watch for Ray Wise (ROBOCOP, DEAD END, AGGRESSION SCALE) in an embarrassing early role!...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Fair, not the worst of the 80's flicks, but honestly didn't make it past 40 minutes. This was boring to me, mostly because of the predictable 80's plot- young handsome rich genius rebel loses girl, has a chip on his shoulder, becomes the anti-hero and gains girl back. The main redeeming feature of the film is R. Lee Emery in an early role. Still, probably an after-school special kind of film if that's what you are in to. Lame sexual humor, lame stereotypical race humor, some lame parts and lags in the script, but the usual fare for this era.
summary: A kinder, gentler R. Lee Emery

Title: N/A

reviewText: I didn't have high expectations going into this one, but apparently that was still too high - the FX are terrible, the dialog is inhuman and stilted, the characters are unrelatable and unbelievable, and the setting is so unreal that all sense of drama and urgency are gone.I stuck with this one as long as I could, but I had no connection to the characters and the 'submarine' made so little sense that I couldn't suspend disbelief and therefore couldn't get invested in the 'danger' they were in.I'm astounded this movie got made, to be honest. Give this one a miss.
Title: N/A
